page.title: 03CURWORTHY FARM
page.content: { Curworthy Farm}is an experimental farm run by the Farmers Weekly Magasine. They also make cheese. The cheese is sold all over Great Britain. Curworthy Farm is owned by a Mr Smith but the{Farmers Weekly}rent it from him. Mr David Morton actually lives there at the moment and he is the manager. The house was built in Tudor Times,(at about}1590_1600). Curworthy Farm was in the first {Domesday Book. On the farm there are approximately 105 cows and 550 ewes and approximately 800 lambs and there are 35 fields to keep them on. There are no bulls as they use artificial Insemination.There is a Commodore Computer used for keeping track of any illnesses. The milking parlour holds 20 cows at a time. There are 100 acres of woodland used mainly for shooting.
